headline: Easy Tuna Casserole
description: This tuna pasta casserole is made with macaroni, creamy chicken soup, and Cheddar cheese. Top with crispy fried onions for a very comforting meal.

video.description: This simple tuna casserole uses just five ingredients, and is a crowd pleaser.
video.name: Easy Tuna Casserole

name: Easy Tuna Casserole
recipeIngredient: 1 (10.5 ounce) can condensed cream of chicken soup

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Combine cooked macaroni, tuna, and condensed soup together in a 9x13-inch baking dish; sprinkle with cheese.
Bake in the preheated oven until bubbly, about 25 minutes. Sprinkle with fried onions; bake 5 minutes more.

review.reviewBody: My kids LOVE this minus the onions on top -- We divide the pan - half with onions and half without. So easy!

I have tried this before. I altered the second time. I put 1/2 can of cream of celery soup, some sweet peas (frozen type), 1 TBSP onion flakes. Instead of dried onions on top, I used crushed cornflakes with some melted butter.
It was very good we love it
Simple and easy. I always throw in peas, cheese, and French fried onions in the recipe before going in the oven! Kids love it! This one is a keeper!

I made this today! This is just a very good basic recipe for Tuna Casserole. A great recipe for an inexperienced cook just getting started or an experienced cook who knows what flavors they personally like. After reading some of the comments, I added a cup and a half of frozen peas. I also added some garlic powder and onion powder. Also, about half a cup of milk. Can't go wrong with this recipe! 5 stars if you like a bland tasting casserole. I had to jazz mine up a little bit. The french=fried onion rings on top make this delicious.
a favorite of my daughter
No.

Great recipe and easy to make! Totally agree with the other review that 2 cans of tuna is needed instead of 1. I did two this time, but I think might even do 3 next time! I made this will kinds of pasta, including bowties and penne and they're equally great!
I added more veggies, and sprinkled the top with cheddar & sourcream potato chips. It was great, everyone asked for seconds!

I was looking for a yummy quick tuna casserole and this recipe delivered, thanks to a few adjustments per helpful reviews. I used 4 generous cups of cooked egg yolks pasta, 2 tuna cans, 1 can of chicken cream (low salt), 1 can of mushroom cream (low salt), 1 large tablespoon Dijon mustard, 2 large mayo tablespoons, about 3/4 cup half & half, celery salt, Italian seasoning, cumin, garlic powder, salt & pepper, added a bunch of three cheddar mix and finally, topped with bread crumbs, and pizza mozza. 25 min. in oven. Then topped up with more breadcrumbs and crispy fried onions. Now trying not to eat the whole pan in one sitting!!!

I subbed Cream of Mushroom soup for the Cream of Chicken since that is what I had. I also added a can of peas and probably too much macaroni because I didn't pay much attention to the measurements to be honest. I would probably make it again paying more attention to how much macaroni I use. I thought the recipe maybe could use more soup as well though.
Easy and delicious. I added some frozen peas, but otherwise made as written. Thanks for the recipe!
My husband loved it. It was creamy and very flavorful.
Only enough ingredients for an 8x8x2 pan; and I think only serves 4 not 8.

Awesome recipe! I did follow others recommendations and added 2 cans of soup, 2 cans of tuna, milk, frozen peas and some garlic powder. I also added my own twist by crushing up some Cheez-it crackers and adding some cheddar cheese. This was the topping. My husband who says he doesn't like tuna, loved this!
my mom always added cream of celery soup
It was easy to make and tasted great. Did a few changes, used, cream of mushroom soup and fusilli pasta. Made the French fried onions from Allrecipes. Will certainly make this again.

Great basic Tuna Casserole recipe. Excellent for when your looking for sonething quick and easy. 

For future I might consider adding some veggies to it but the recipe is good as is as well.
I made it - it was OK - but very dry. I did add celery and green pepper for some crunch. If I had to make again, I'd add a second can of soup.
I loved this, very easy. I added peas.

This recipe was good. I used breadcrumbs instead of the French fried onions. I did think it came out a little dry, so next time I’d use 2 cans of soup and 2 cans of tuna. Overall, I thought it was great though!
Sub for cream of mushroom soup and breadcrumbs
Great taste, needs more tuna in my opinion. Added a splash of almond milk, salt, pepper.
It was dry and did not have enough tuna. I will not be making this again.
I followed this recipe exactly and was bitterly disappointed. It was dry and tasteless. It may be easy but it sucks.
l made this according to the Martins tweaks plus added peas. It was really, really good. Super creamy and the bread crumbs were delicious. A definite keeper.
Really good I added corn so we had a veggie but it’s delicious with or without corn

I didn't have cream of chicken. I added a can of cream of mushroom and a can of cream of celery (Full box of pasta). *2 cans of tuna. My husband was never a fan of Tuna casserole. Tonight he had a 2nd serving :) He said this recipe is a keeper! Quick & easy with standard pantry ingredients.

I seldom make tuna casserole (like once every 4-5 years seldom) and then I"ll make one when I want something different. This exceeded my expectations! Husband liked it and daughter came in from work, took a bite, and said this is really good! I know substitute crackers, chips or whatever but I think the fried onion rings was the magic. Also the recipes didnt say anything about green peas but the picture showed green peas so I added a handful of frozen green peas to the mix. Saving the recipe. 

I had bought the fried onions rings specifically for this recipe and they should have been fresh; they weren't. I put them in the oven in a separate pan while the casserole was cooking so they 'crisp up' somewhat. They weren't as crisp as I wanted them but the taste was still really good.

It turned out great! It's a hit every time I make it! The only things I added are an extra can of soup, 2 cans of mushrooms, and a small bag of frozen peas. The first time I made it I took it to a wedding and it disappeared so fast that I only got a tiny scoop to try it myself!
Easy and very good. Just added a little milk.Thanks I will make it again
It's definitely easy, so 5 stars on that but it's probably not something I'd ever try again.

This was my 1st tuna casserole ever, followed some suggestions and added a can of cream mushroom. Put a generous helping of cheese on top (we love cheese!). Next time will add some salt & pepper. Overall yummy and would make again.
Added one can of tuna, cream of mushroom, and peas and carrots

I made this with left over chicken breast wrapped in bacon and cream of celery soup...DELISH 

I just made it with tuna and cream of chicken soup and I added celery and green onions....so good

I would DEFINITELY make AGAIN
Excellent. Did not have French Fried Onions so I used bread crumbs.

In order to keep it from being too bland, I added a small amount, about 1/3 cup, minced onions, fresh cracked black pepper and a 1/2 tsp of tabasco. I ate way too much of it in one day. My fave comfort food!

I love the ease and the taste of this recipe. I added extra thanks time only because I prefer it. I've had a meal today and will portion out the rest for future meals from the freezer.
 Great recipe. I'll make it again.
Loved it! Added some green onions. Good recipe.

The recipe was great. The crispy onions added a nice flavor to this dish. I glad that others put their versions and critique a recipe. Sometimes you don't have all the ingredients that someone lists. So it is nice to know there are alterations you can make and it will still be delicious. So here are my changes. I added 1/2 can of milk, added some peas, and used egg noodles.
This is a delicious dish, great way to use tuna in a way everyone will love it. I love the crunchy top layer.
Double the recipe if you want left overs. I topped with keg steak spice before cooking. Delicious
was not a big fan of it. was very dry
First time ever making tuna casserole and I'll definitely make it again. Tasty and very easy to make.

Great recipe. I substituted the cream of chicken soup with cream of celery and cream of mushroom. I also seasoned with black pepper, seafood seasoning, old bay, and garlic powder. Turned out delicious. My whole family loved it!

Made this for my daughter as I'm looking for different things to cook during quarantine. I added onion powder, garlic powder, pepper, frozen peas, tablespoon of mayo and mixed this all together with the tuna and also added cheese in the tuna mix, then added the pasta. Topped with cheese. 5 minutes before done added the fried onions. It was a HIT!! This will be a go to easy meal for me to prepare in the future.

I made this for dinner tonight and everyone loved it! I have been requested to make it again. Next time I will add some capers to cut down on a little bit of the richness of the dish. I also used about seven cloves of garlic and the juice of half a lemon. Thanks for the recipe.
Creamy nos tasty!
It’s a great family comfort food recipe. I don’t understand why some make a totally different recipe and then rate this recipe.
I made this and it was delicious ,
Made this as written, was absolutely delicious. Will use as go to during lent. Served with a tossed salad and veggies on the side.

It was easy and good. We ate too much, though! As some have noted, the recipe is forgiving and lends itself to variations. I made is just as is., but might try to lighten it up a bit in the future. The french-fried onion rock.
Love this! It's easy to make, comfort food.
Simple and delicious. Exactly what I was looking for.

I’m not fond of tuna casserole but I will say this recipe is the best I have ever had and everyone loved it. Although I did feel it was a little dry so next time I will add a little milk with the soup. I will definitely cook this again. I was looking for low potassium recipes as my husband has kidney disease and this one came up and I’m so glad I found it.

Great for a base recipe BUT I nearly had to double the ingredients to fill a 9x13 pan. Other than that, it was good. I needed to add salt and pepper at the table. Everyone at the potluck liked it. Next time I'll add garlic salt and pepper to the soup mixture and use cream of chicken, cream of mushroom, and cream of celery. I think that will give it more flavor. Four stars because it's a starter recipe.

Was a bit dry. Needs some milk or broth but just a small amount. I would also prefer cream of mushroom soup instead of cream of chicken and I used lite mozzarella cheese instead of cheddar to reduce fat.
This was bland. I usually read suggestions by other cooks but didn’t this time. I will next time.

The recipe did not call for milk with the condensed soup. WhenI followed the recipe - only substituting ingredients that I had in the cupboard, mushroom soup for chicken, it was very disappointing. The following night when I added milk and reheated the leftovers in a double boiler it was much better. If I make this again I will add the milk at the beginning.

It is delicious! I made it with 7 cups of macaroni, 2 cans of tuna added 2 cans of cream of chicken soup and one can of mushroom soup. I didn’t have fried onions, so I crumbled potato chips on top instead. Mmmmmmm

I made this casserole for my family. They were not too excited for tuna casserole, but after all of us had seconds, I knew this was a winner! Husband had it the next 2 days for lunch. Super easy! The only thing I added was one bag of frozen peas and carrots (I cooked them first) so I could get more veggies into the kids, lol. One of my kids said how much they loved the fried onions. Great recipe! Thanks for sharing.
Needed more tuna. Otherwise very tasty.

I liked the cheesy flavor, but it was too dry for me. I will add some milk to the soup mix to compensate for that. I used Fusilli noodles because I had some and found I like the way those noodles pick up the sauce and tuna with each bite. Also, I like lots of tuna so I put in two cans.

This is a great recipe. I did add two cans of cream of mushroom 1/2 cup of milk sharp cheddar cheese in the mixture as well as on top and peas. II also only had short macaroni noodles but they work out fine. Family loved it. The French fried onions really gave it nice texture!

Great recipe! I didn’t have fried onions so I crushed white cheddar cheez-it’s and baked them on top the whole time the casserole was in and they added some tangy deliciousness! Also used 1/2 cup milk and two cans of chicken condensed soup cuz I’m a saucy girl! Will make again!
so delicious
I have 4 star only because I added a can of cream of mushroom and cheddar to the mixture. Otherwise follow the recipe and it is delicious.
Loved this recipe. I was able to make just enough for one person.
Very Yummy..The kids loved it, and they aren't fans of fish. Peas and garlic were the only additions I made, but that's personal preference.
Deelish
I will add fresh chopped tomatoes on top next time i make it. I loved the flavors it brought me back to my childhood
I don't why anyone liked this? Not nearly enough tuna. All we tasted was the Fried Onions. I see why people are suggesting two cans of tuna, and two cans of soup.

Based on other reviews, I used 2 cans of tuna & 2 cans of soup. I didn't have any French fried onion rings so I used crushed potato chips. 

It was very good, however, I will have to add milk when I re-heat it because it was still a bit dry, even though I baked it for the time specified.

Thanks for the recipe!

I loved this casserole! The only change I made was to add about 1/4 cup of milk. It was still on the dry side, but that's what I loved about it. I like my mac and cheese on the dry side too. I used bow-tie macaroni and medium cheddar cheese. The onion topping gave it just the right tasty crunchy finish. It was excellent reheated too.
I definitely will make this one again.
I followed recipe and it was good,but I noticed the picture had peas in the dish. May try that the next time I make it.
Pretty good base receipe. I made exactly as written the first time. Plan to heed other's advice and make some additions next time as it needed more flavor and moisture.
Bland, seriously needs some punching up. Fresh dill, pepper, something lol I'm going to have to work on it.

The flavor combinations in this are five stars. However, I see why many others made changes; it is very dry. I say make as is with the addition of 1 cup milk, or a second can of soup. Either one will make this a five star dinner.
No changes. Often will make it.
I doubled the recipe for the 9x13 in Pyrex pan. It was perfect according to my 11yr old son who is picky when it comes to food such as not putting the cheese on one side.
This dish was good to make for someone who doesn’t like to cook. Very easy to make and very delicious! Since I didn’t have macaroni, I ended up using penne pasta and the dish came out just fine.
Delicious and so easy as written!
i wanted an easy quick recipe not one with more ingredients and steps. this one looks great!! thanks. i am confident it will be delicious. if not - i'll be back!!

Best and indeed the easiest tuna casserole EVER!
My Dad and I have been looking for a great and easy tuna casserole for many years. Due to having surgery and recovering I finally found time to find one and LOVE IT!

I followed the recipe to a T with a few little changes. Here is what I did differently:

I used a smaller casserole dish, sprayed bottom and inside with butter spray, mixed everything (macaroni, tuna, soup, 1/2 cup cheese, 1/4 cup frozen peas) in a big plastic favorite bowl. Next I put mixed ingredients in dish, added 1/2 cup cheese on top then baked for 25minutes.

The last thing I did was put total of 3/4 cup of Fried french onions on top and baked 5 minutes.

Best Tuna Casserole dish I've tasted in years! The smile on my Dads face when he was eating was PRICELESS! ?
Made as is but with cream of celery soup since I didn't have cream of chicken. I used egg noodles. I also added a small can of mushrooms. This is a keeper!
Good as is!

As written it only makes enough for a thin layer in a 9X13 pan. Once I added the tuna to the pasta and saw the ratio of tuna to pasta I added another can of tune. Unfortunately I didn't have a second can of soup to add. I will for next time. It wasn't bad as written but I think will be improved with doubling the tuna and soup from as written.

This is a great recipe - I have made it before and will make it again. Always make it slightly different based on what I have in my kitchen cabinets and fridge. Usually double for four with two growing kids and the dish is empty! Thank you!
Delicious! Will definitely make it again.
Really enjoyed this recipe. I added a few twists like adding broccoli, a splash of yogurt and some extra cheese. The end result was amazing.
Add or subtract anything you please. Modify it or not. Add stuff that will go bad if you don't or additional spices. It's good regardless.
very easy and few ingredients. My husband loves it!
This was good, but I added 4 cups of noodles and two cans of tuna. (Otherwise there is not really enough to bother with a 13x9 pan.) I also added sauted mushrooms and some green onion chopped.

As is, it was pretty good if a bit bland. Next time, for personal taste, I'll be making some modifications such as adding some peas, some sour cream, etc. I do have to say though, there is no way on earth this amount is going to fill a 9x13 pan or feed 8 people. Divvying up one can of tuna, soup and just 3 cups of macaroni would be skimpy servings for just 4 good eaters unless you add salad and a couple of side dishes to boot.
Made the recipe exactly as written; it doesn't need to be changed at all, and is super easy to make. It is perfectly delicious!Makes a nice weekend meal, with leftovers for lunch during the week.
I made this easy tuna casserole recipe and my family loved it!
I made this easy tuna casserole recipe and my family loved it!
The additions by Melanie were GREAT! Thanks for the recipe and the reviews!
I ended up needing to double the soup and tuna. But it was really good both me and the hubs went for seconds!
